definitions.example: When the horn sounds, take cover.

definitions.definition: To convey an impression by one's sound.
definitions.example: He sounded good when we last spoke.

definitions.definition: To be conveyed in sound; to be spread or published; to convey intelligence by sound.
(often with in) To arise or to be recognizable as arising in or from a particular area of law.
To cause to produce a sound.
(of a vowel or consonant) To pronounce.
Dive downwards, used of a whale.
definitions.example: The whale sounded and eight hundred feet of heavy line streaked out of the line tub before he ended his dive.

definitions.definition: To ascertain, or try to ascertain, the thoughts, motives, and purposes of (a person); to examine; to try; to test; to probe.
definitions.example: When I sounded him, he appeared to favor the proposed deal.

definitions.definition: Test; ascertain the depth of water with a sounding line or other device.
definitions.example: Mariners on sailing ships would sound the depth of the water with a weighted rope.

definitions.definition: To examine with the instrument called a sound or sonde, or by auscultation or percussion.
definitions.example: to sound a patient, or the bladder or urethra
